title: Badosa Responds to Criticism Over Match Withdrawal in Dubai
summary: Paula Badosa, a former world number two tennis player from Spain, has addressed accusations of being 'disrespectful to the game' after retiring from a match at the Dubai Tennis Championships. She withdrew due to a right thigh injury while leading against Elina Svitolina, having previously beaten Katerina Siniakova. This follows four retirements last year, and Badosa has contemplated ending her career in 2024 because of chronic injuries, including back problems. On social media, a user criticized her frequent withdrawals, prompting Badosa to explain the challenges of living with a chronic injury. She described daily struggles with pain, efforts to find solutions, and her determination to continue playing tennis out of love for the sport. Badosa also highlighted the toxicity of social media, linking it to mental health issues among players. Despite her high ranking in 2022 and a recent semi-final at the Australian Open, her current rank has dropped to 70th, underscoring the impact of injuries on her career.
